intro: Tithymalus gasparrinii, commonly known as the Gasparinii tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Tithymalus gasparrinii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
